the business was relatively successful mostly because I was doing about 80 hours away and just doing everything

I think maybe he could tell that I needed a bit of help because he offered a trade of his business coaching

I didn't know and I said yes the first thing that Bernie got me to do was the

practice being less of a control freak I practiced delegating more and empowering and using a lot more positive

so I guess my key learnings through that experience was delegating delegating and

know when somebody comes to me and they're like oh look this is what I've done ask myself is it good enough
because it doesn't matter if I can see a tiny little area for improvement is it
good enough and if it's good enough to say great job it means so much to people when you just say great job as opposed

develop and learn was upwards managing and I don't know if everybody knows what

understand what they're trying to achieve and genuinely trying to understand you know what equals success

is focusing on what they're good at everybody is good at something even the
most annoying people in the world everyone is good at something so if you focus on for me I had to focus on okay
what can I learn from this manager where's that thing that they're exceptional at and focusing on that you
know helped my perception of them and it just made the whole experience a lot easier so I think it's a really
important skill to develop as a leader because it's our job to protect our team's sometimes from from managers that

I want to make the point that even if we don't care about titles it is important that it reflects what we actually do

so I wasn't in Kansas anymore I was in Australia and and I I was I'd actually
kind of I started to miss the community of kind of full-time work so I'd still

of years of developing day-to-day I decided that I wanted to kind of progress I wanted to be able to affect
the company and try and help improve things um and to do that I kind of had
to take a step back and look at the kind of leader that I wanted to be and for me
this kind of the way I categorize it is there's three different kinds of leadership that I think of the first is
that that functional leadership which is for us and technical leadership where you're still writing code but you're
doing kind of manager II things and might be for the team might be for the project then there's kind of people
leadership which is where you stepped away you are directly managing people or leading people you're looking after them
day-to-day you have no technical involvement now the third is kind of strategic leadership that's where you
are helping the company or helping your organization to figure out where they should go or what they should do and
those roles are can be quite different you know in some companies you know that strategic leadership doesn't happen
until a kind of a director level or a CTO level and and in most companies that
